intro: Lessertia speciosa, commonly known as the yellow bell, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its striking yellow, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. The flowers bloom in clusters and are pollinated primarily by birds, particularly sunbirds.
